meanings.definition: Supplementary material at the end of a book or document.
meanings.sent1: The appendixes in the textbook contained additional information for the students.
meanings.sent2: I always check the appendixes of a book to see if there are any useful charts or graphs.
meanings.sent3: The appendixes were like a treasure trove of extra details hidden at the back of the report.
meanings.sent4: Her notebook was like an appendixes, filled with extra notes and explanations.
meanings.sent5: The appendixes were like a bonus section, providing more insights beyond the main text.

meanings.definition: An organ in the body that is connected to the intestines.
meanings.sent1: The surgeon removed the inflamed appendixes during the emergency operation.
meanings.sent2: When the appendixes becomes infected, it can cause severe pain in the abdomen.
meanings.sent3: The appendixes decided to act up at the worst possible time, leading to a rushed hospital visit.
meanings.sent4: His appendixes felt like a ticking time bomb, ready to cause trouble at any moment.
meanings.sent5: The appendixes, though small, can have a big impact on one's health if not taken care of properly.
